comments.html: Why not simply listen on 0.0.0.0 (any) IP address instead of resolving hostname to IP address of one interface?
comments.name: Anonymous

comments.html:
Right. 0.0.0.0. Maybe because the router also has external-facing interfaces, and Ivan doesn't want to become a free relay for SPAM ? :)

Listening on 0.0.0.0 is asking for trouble. bind to 127.0.0.1 if no need to accept outside connections. bind to specific interfaces otherwise. But try to avoid 0.0.0.0 ;)

""be conservative in what you generate, and liberal in what you accept.""

Going back to the SMTP "basic server" - I've had good results using the Mercury Mail MTA - since 1999, my "ligthweight mail server of choice for lab-related stuff" - http://www.pmail.com/overviews/ovw_mercury.htm
comments.name: Anonymous
